timeline.bodyText:
Can a bean provider not just throw an exception? i.e. add throws to the method signature for this? That seems more natural than rethrowing a runtime exception.
If you can't do this for some reason, then please at least include the exception here, as it stands the original exception is swallowed here
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: I would add a log.severe() here; we will want to pay attention if this happens, since this call might fail as well.
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps instead just update the billing account after you save the workspace. that way it is already on free tier if either step fails
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
If I am saving the workspace with the updates billing account, I believe I still need to make a try/catch call to update the db if the Google call fails.
Proposed

save db w/ new billing account (succeeds)
call google (fails)
save db w/ old billing account to keep state in sync OR delete the workspace b/c the create call didn't fully complete successfully.

Current

call google w/ new billing account (succeeds)
save db (fails)
call google w/ old billing account to keep state in sync

My reasoning for going with the current workflow was that I felt like a db save call is less likely to fail than an API call. There's also the effect of having a partially successful workspace entry in our database. I could see a case for not failing the entire call if the updateBillingInfo call fails since the entire call is quite expensive but I view that more of a feature add on that we can talk to product about.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText: Please use something with jitter and/or backoff, fixed wait is not very graceful.
timeline.author: calbach
calbach
timeline.diffHunk:

           type: string
           required: false
 
+  /v1/user/billingAccounts:
+    get:
+      tags:
+        - user
+      description: Placeholder

timeline.bodyText:
Some cases to make sure are handled here:

The user is an editor (not an owner). We expect this call to 403.
The user is an owner, but doesn't have access to the billing account (i.e. the workspace billing account is not present in the dropdown).
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
It looks like the user is able to call getBillingInfo on the project when they're a writer but they are NOT able to update the billing info. Is this OK? Fixing the permissions so that they can't call getBillingInfo might be non trivial since I think that is managed on FC's side based on how they interpret the writer role.
From AoU's standpoint, they will not be able to update the workspace since only owners can edit Workspace details. We can also just remove the dropdown for writers if we do not want them to be able to see the billing info.
With regards to #2, the logic here got a bit tricky but I think I have something reasonable and there's enough comments that it should be readable. LMK what you think.
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Only owners should be able to change the billing information, so the dropdown should ideally just be disabled for non-owners.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: This seems slightly overfit to me. I'd probably have it return the full JSON response structure, then have the client pick out billingAccountName
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: Noting we'll need to keep this in sync with the actual value. Probably fine for now
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: I can add it. I'm thinking it makes more sense for this value to follow the default free credits value and not the user overridden one. thoughts?
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Yes, default makes sense. It would also be very confusing to explain which user this is referring to (since it depends on the creator, not necesarily the current user's free tier credits).
replies.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: I pulled it out into a function and I think that helped a little. I tried shuffling around the stuff inside but couldn't find a format that I like more than what I already have.
